entry.title: The Groof Toll
entry.summary: Took a wrong turn and Groof wanted more treats
entry.content:
Groof's mouth is already full of treats! I had walked up a little to leave treats on the ramp, but both Groof and Groofriend landed so that I would have to pass them on the way back down. Groof does some good flappy hops.

[[video:groof-toll]]

entry.title: Purple Groof
entry.content:
I'm not sure what causes them to look like this, I think the angle of the sun? Maybe I should look up the time of day I took it and try again. It adds to my suspicion that crows see UV light and is maybe part of how they tell each other apart.

[[video:groof-purple]]

entry.title: Crow Butt
entry.summary: What a cutie! They were pretty scared of the bag and kept peeping in.
entry.content: Such pretty tail feathers too

entry.title: Egg
entry.content:
I think they can't hold it down due to their foot? I smooshed the egg up for them a little, and then they were able to fly off with it. They had already stashed a bunch of peanuts too. Longlegs is happy to receive a lot of treats it seems.

[[video:longlegs-cant-grab-egg]]

entry.title: Egg Teacher
entry.summary: One crow teaching another how to do egg
entry.content:
I think this might be Groof's honker? Really hard to say. I thought they were Groof at first because they recognized me, but they're super scared of the egg and tube and Groof just went at the tube yesterday.

After they peck the egg, they walk off to the side and give me a sad crow look pretty similar to what Groof does ðŸ˜¿ [[video:scaredy-crow]]

A different crow, maybe Groof? comes and helps them with chatters of encouragement. [[video:crow-encouragement]] [[video:egg-tube-extract]]

Part of why I think they're a juvenile is how excited their lil' trots are. Egg Drop is one of my favorite special crow moves. I need to make a list of them all. [[video:egg-drop]]

entry.title: Power Pecks
entry.content:
I just sit down on a bench, and Groof shows up! [[video:wait-for-groof]]

This is the first time I've seen Groof pierce the tube. I like seeing them use their feet manipulate stuff. They got a ton of treats today. [[video:groof-power-pecks]]

Maybe they get peck practice in when they take the tubes to the Groof roof.

entry.title: Groofy morning
entry.summary: Groof/friend get a tube and an egg
entry.content:
Some dork passed by which was funny [[video:groof-ped-dont-see-everyday]]

Groof pecking at the tube. Do they just like pecking? It does look satisfying. Good pecks. [[video:groof-peck-at-tube]][[video:groof-tube-heist]]

Groof leaves with egg while Groofriend distracts me. Looking back at the video, it was kind of obvious that Groof was about to knock the egg off. [[video:groof-egg-heist]]

entry.title: Squirrel Attack!
entry.content:
I was at the kitty loft waiting for her to come home from surg and went out to visit her crow friends. They ate all the peanuts I had!

I saw the squirrel to the side and was thinking they were dangerous but they still got me off guard. Sometimes I see them on reddit getting along with crows, but now I know they're a hazard.

Afterwards I went back to the kitty loft and got more treats for them.

[[video:squirrel-attack]]

entry.title: It's Green Bandit
entry.summary: I only see them maybe once a month? Glad too see they're doing well ðŸ˜Š
entry.content:
This is Green Bandit, who I assume is research crow from UW. They seem pretty friendly. I've seen crows with the green bands maybe a dozen times now, but not sure if they're all the same crow. [[video:green-bandit-greeting]]

Green Bandit can carry two peanuts, but not three, so they call their friend for help. They can caw with their beak full of peanuts apparently! But honkers need to use their whole body to honk. Also it seems like pigeons have started sensing that I have food, but they probably can't open peanuts or eggs. [[video:green-bandit-calls-for-assistance]]

Their friend heisted the egg away. Maybe they've had a gobbo egg before? [[video:friend-of-green-bandit-egg-heist]]

entry.title: Swooped by Longlegs
entry.content:
I didn't they were Longlegs until Catgirl pointed out their injured foot. It felt like it had been a while since I had seen them, but I think I just wasn't identifying them.

They're so friendly! So exciting when they get close. I reacted too slowly to catch the swoop by my head on video.

[[video:longlegs-swoop]] [[video:longlegs-approach]] [[video:longlegs-hop]]

entry.title: The Merp-Dump
entry.content:
Merp likes to shake all the treats out of bags. It's one of the ways I identify them! They are looking very pretty today. Berp was also around to pick up stray treats.

[[video:merp-dump]]

entry.title: The Three Peanut Problem
entry.summary: How to carry away 3 peanuts at once?

entry.title: Grabby Groof
entry.content:
Groof and Groofriend vying for treats

Groof is the slightly larger one with a rounder beak, and the instigator.

[[video:groof-grab]] [[video:groof-caw-at-groofriend]] [[video:groofriend-snips-at-groof]]

Groof wants more

I love the cute groof look. [[video:groof-wants-more]]

entry.title: Groof Greeting
entry.content:
Groof took another tube to the Groof roof after.

[[video:groof-greeting]]

entry.title: Hop hop hop
entry.content:
I think the hoppy one is Longlegs, and the other is Fussy? The peanut crow was never able to pick up 3 peanuts at once.

[[video:hop-hop-hop]]
